subtitleNullable: Dataset with 800 Pokemon include with 1 vs 1 combat and team 6 vs 6 combat
descriptionNullable:
### Context
Pokemon is a symbol of our youth. I also used to enjoy pokemon movies or play pokemon games like that, those are great. And in my exploration of previous Pokemon datasets, I've come across many different ways to add data to enrich this dataset, as simple as teaming up with 6 vs 6 Pokemon against each other.

### Content

This dataset has a total of 4 csv files. 2 files (`combat.csv` and `pokemon.csv`) of which I referenced from this dataset . The other 2 files I created from an idea model: 6 vs 6 team match.

I trained my classifier Random Forest machine learning model for predicting which Pokemon will win in a match. The model has worked very well on the training set, it has an accuracy rate of `94%` on the test set, more details I will leave in the kernel in the `Code` section.

### Acknowledgements

We wouldn't be here without the help of others.
Thanks for this dataset https://www.kaggle.com/terminus7/pokemon-challenge dataset for the `combat.csv` and `pokemon.csv`.

### Inspiration

Since the questioning process is the first step for any data science project, you may want to ask a few questions before you begin analyzing the set.
It's may be:
- Which one is the strongest Pokemon?
- Which Pokemon has the highest win rate?
- Which Pokemon team has the highest win rate?
- Which Machine Learning model is best suit for predict a Pokemon is legendary or not?
Let curiosity take over you.

### Disclaimer
This is not an official data set from the Pokemon manufacturer, the team battle data files are created by myself from highly accurate machine learning models on the test set.
